AttackModel.NameOfTheChallenge: N-day Local File Inclusion (LFI) vulnerability in PHP-Proxy
AttackerCapabilities: Ability to read and modify Python scripts
Familiarity with encryption and decryption algorithms

SecurityMeasures: URL encryption using a weak encryption algorithm
Absence of explicit ban on file:// protocol

Steps.Description: Perform directory busting scan to find interesting information

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker is searching for hidden files or directories that may contain sensitive information or vulnerabilities.
StepDetails.Action: Run gobuster with a common wordlist to scan for directories and files on the target website.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker discovers the existence of /flag.txt and /app directories.

Steps.Description: Exploit the LFI vulnerability in PHP-Proxy

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker knows that PHP-Proxy is vulnerable to LFI and aims to exploit it to read sensitive files.
StepDetails.Action: Utilize the provided exploit script to perform the LFI attack.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully retrieves the content of the /var/www/html/flag.txt file, which contains the flag.
